thread.title: Haverford School outlasts Penn Charter in 3 OTs
thread.title_full: Haverford School outlasts Penn Charter in 3 OTs

title: Haverford School outlasts Penn Charter in 3 OTs
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports In the first overtime, both teams traded touchdown passes. In the second overtime, the Fords' Peter Solomon blocked a 23-yard field-goal attempt.
Toal threw for two touchdowns and rushed for three. Hnatkowsky threw for four touchdowns. The team's quarterbacks were involved in a combined 100 plays. 
Haverford School, the 10th-ranked team in Southeastern Pennsylvania by The Inquirer, improved to 6-0. 
CATHOLIC LEAGUE AA 
West Catholic 48, Bishop McDevitt 13: Craig Jones scored five touchdowns, including two on punt returns, to lead the Burrs at Widener University. 
PUBLIC LEAGUE AAAA LIBERTY 
Bartram 22, Frankford 16: Answered Gleyplay accounted for all 20 of the visiting Braves' points, rushing for three touchdowns and a two-point conversion. 
Central 31, Fels 0: Blake Schwartz and Jeffery Coplin each ran for a pair of touchdowns at Northeast. Coplin netted 67 yards on nine carries and Schwartz carried the ball eight times for 37 yards. 
Simon Gratz 61, Kensington 0: Luke White rushed nine times for 203 yards and five touchdowns for the 16th-ranked hosts 
PUBLIC LEAGUE AAAA INDEPENDENCE 
Olney 50, Roxborough 20: Malik Smith rushed for 71 yards and three touchdowns on 13 carries to lead Olney at home. Cam'ron Izzard netted 110 rushing yards and a pair of TDs. Will Hunter rushed 14 times for 134 yards. In the fourth quarter, the junior intercepted a pass and took it 62 yards for a touchdown to complete a stream of 20-unanswered points. 
PUBLIC LEAGUE CLASS AAA 
Imhotep Charter 56, Dobbins 8: Mike Waters ran for 152 yards and five touchdowns in home win. Nasir Boykin completed 14 of 18 passes for 272 yards and three touchdowns for the top-ranked Panthers. 
SUBURBAN ONE CONTINENTAL 
Council Rock South 39, William Tennent 0: Brendan Patterson scored three touchdowns, including a 90-yard kickoff return, for the 19th-ranked visiting Golden Hawks. 
DEL-VAL LEAGUE 
Chester 25, Glen Mills 6: Jaquan Flood ran for a TD and caught a 49-yard pass from Amaige Merritt for another on the road-.
